Regularly revisit and discover an ever-growing variety of wonderful palettes, added daily.

plugins.name: Image Resizer Plugin
plugins.description:
Main Features:


Resize Image: Choose from a list of commonly used image sizes or enter your desired dimensions separated by commas.

Export High-Quality Images: Export your images in high-quality 300 DPI JPGs and PNGs, perfect for print and detailed presentations.

Mockup automation: Add your product into mockups in one click.


How It Works:


Resize and Export:

Select the image you want to resize or export within your Figma project.

Launch the Image Resizer plugin.

For resizing, choose from the list of predefined sizes or enter your custom dimensions.

For exporting, select your desired format and ensure you choose the 300 DPI option for high-quality results.

Click "Resize" or "Export", and the plugin will process your images instantly.


Automated Mockup Generator:

  • Bring your own mockups
  • Name frames as 'MockupFrame'
  • Name placeholders as 'ImagePlaceholder'
  • Select an image, text, group. or shape in Figma
  • Click "Add to Mockup" and the plugin will add your product to mockups instantly.


Trial & Payment:

Image Resizer operates on a freemium model. Users are allowed to use the plugin for a trial period of up to 15 uses. After the trial usages are exhausted, users will be prompted to make a payment to continue using the plugin without restrictions.


How to manage subscriptions?

You may only subscribe through the Image Resizer Plugin, we only export your figma user id to manage the subscription.


You may easily manage your subscription in Stripe through below link.

https://billing.stripe.com/p/login/aEUbLA6vh59HfcI5kk


If any questions or support needed, you may contact us via the contact email.
plugins.tagline: Swiftly resize images, export them in high-quality formats and automate mockup workflows.

plugins.name: Font Switcher
plugins.description:
Switch the font family from the quick actions and keep the font weight.


The font weight will be retained if the new font family has that weight.


How to:

  1. Select some nodes with texts (Text, Sticky, Connector, Shapes with text, etc.)
  2. Open quick action (Win: Ctrl+/ or Ctrl+P) - (Mac: Cmd + / or Cmd + P)
  3. Type "Font switcher" and press Tab
  4. Reach your font and press "Enter"

plugins.name: Make Filled
plugins.description:
Fill shapes and include the original outline


  1. Fill outlined vector shapes and include the original outline
  2. Useful for icons that have both an outlined and a filled style
  3. Works with rectangles, ellipses, polygons, stars, closed vector shapes, and boolean operation groups
  4. Select groups, frames, and boolean operation groups to fill every compatible shape inside
  5. Original stroke colour will be applied as the fill colour of the final shape


  1. Create a boolean operation group that includes the stroke and the fill using the “Make Filled” command
  2. Create a flattened version of the final shape using the “Make Filled and Flatten” command
  3. Merge multiple shapes into a single vector layer using the “Make Filled and Merge” command


Notes


This plugin ignores invisible layers.


Do you have a feature request? Let me know on GitHub or Mastodon :)


This plugin is open source on GitHub


Made by @johjakob

accepted.name: Johannes Jakob
accepted.description: Designer and Artist

plugins.tagline: Fill shapes and include the original outline

plugins.name: BG Remover & Image Enhancer by Picsart
plugins.description:
Better than Native: Supercharge Your Figma Workflow with Background Removal & Boost Resolution – Try 40 Images Free


Transform your design process with the Picsart Plugin for Figma—a powerful alternative to Figma’s native Remove Background and Boost Resolution tools. Designed for UI/UX designers, marketers, product teams, and creatives, this plugin lets you enhance images with precision and ease—and process up to 40 images for free when you sign up.


Key Features

1. AI-Powered Background Removal

Effortlessly remove unwanted backgrounds to create professional, clean visuals in seconds. Perfect for isolating product images, custom icons, or design elements.


2. Ultra-Resolution Image Upscaling

Upscale images up to 8x while preserving quality. Ensure your visuals look sharp and professional across all screen sizes and resolutions.


3. Effortless Integration

No need to switch between tools. Work seamlessly within Figma and let the plugin handle tedious edits, so you can focus on your creative vision.


4. Broad File Compatibility

Supports JPG, PNG, TIFF, WEBP, and MPO formats for maximum flexibility in your design projects.


Why Choose the Picsart Plugin?

  1. Save Time: Automate repetitive tasks and accelerate your design process.
  2. Boost Productivity: Streamline workflows with features that simplify image editing.
  3. Enhance Creativity: Unlock new creative possibilities with advanced tools at your fingertips.


Popular Use Cases

  1. E-commerce Product Design: Remove backgrounds and upscale product images for clean, professional listings that shine on any device.
  2. Social Media Graphics: Create polished, engaging visuals for posts, stories, and ads with high-resolution images.
  3. Marketing Collateral: Design stunning banners, flyers, and brochures with customized, crisp visuals.
  4. Custom UI/UX Elements: Generate high-quality icons, buttons, and components that stay sharp across screen sizes.


How to Set Up the Plugin

  1. Sign Up for an API Key: Visit Picsart and register for free to get your API key. You’ll be able to remove backgrounds or upscale up to 40 images for free—no payment required.
  2. Activate the Plugin: Open Figma, navigate to the Plugins menu, and activate the Picsart Plugin. Input your API key to start using the tools immediately.
  3. Recharge When Needed: When your free credits run out, easily top up by purchasing more at our pricing page.


Get Started Today

Say goodbye to complex workflows and hello to seamless design efficiency. Download the Picsart Plugin for Figma and elevate your designs with AI-powered background removal and ultra-resolution upscaling.


Learn More & Get Started
plugins.tagline: Remove Background & Boost Resolution – 40 Free Images with Signup

plugins.name: Status ✅
plugins.description:
When collaborating on features with multiple designers and developers, it can be hard to keep track of which designs are ready to be implemented and what is still a work in progress.

Status for Figma brings order to the chaos by providing a simple way to mark the status of a design. Simple right-click on your frame, go to Plugins, Status, and select your desired status.

Some tips:
- You can select multiple frames at once. Each frame will get its own status badge.
- Use the keyboard shortcut to quickly set a status: hit `cmd /` in Mac and `ctrl /` on Windows, type a Status (e.g. “Done”) and hit return.
- Status for Figma is not limited to frames. It works with any object you can select.
- You can optionally automatically group the selected element and status badge, so they can be moved around easily (see the plugin settings)

Status for Figma is open source. Feel free to contribute or to send suggestions. https://github.com/bramschulting/status-for-figma

plugins.name: JP Font Switcher
plugins.description:
JP Font Switcher

JP Font Switcherは、Figma上で日本語フォントを簡単に切り替えることができるプラグインです。


機能

  • 日本語フォントの一覧・プレビュー表示
  • 日本語フォントの検索
  • フォントスタイルの選択と適用（複数テキスト同時適用可）


使い方

  1. Figmaでテキストオブジェクトを選択
  2. ブラグインメニューから、JP Font Switcherを選択
  3. プラグインのウィンドウで、任意のフォントのスタイルをクリック


特定のローカルのフォントが表示されないとき

plugins.name: Commentor
plugins.description:
Write the comments and explanations to your design in the Figma.

Buy me a coffee ☕


How to use the plugin:

  • Select the layer;
  • Enter the comment number (optional) and text;
  • Select the color of the label (red by default);
  • Choose whether or not to show the author of the comment;
  • Click «Create Comment»


The plugin will automatically create a new frame with a comment next to the selected frame. Each comment will try to align against the selected layer.


Update Positions

If the coordinates of the layers associated with the comments have been changed, then the comments and labels will try to align next to it. This will work for the frames you have selected or for every frame on the page if you have not selected anything. This function is automatically called when a new comment is created.


Show/Hide Labels

Show or hide labels inside frames.


Remove unused labels

If you deleted a comment and want to remove unused label, use this function.


Limitations in the plugin:

- Plugin works on a single selected layer;

- The label field is optional and must be a number in the range 0 to 99;

- Functions "Show/Hide labels" and "Remove unused labels" work for all the frames on the page.
plugins.tagline: Write the comments and explanations to your design in the Figma

plugins.name: typeff
plugins.description:
TypEff is a typing effect plugin that enables users to create dynamic text animations within their Figma designs. It provides three options: typing, deleting, and looping.


With the typing option, users can simulate the effect of text being typed out character by character, creating an animated typing effect. The plugin allows users to customize the typing speed, font, and other properties to achieve the desired effect.


The deleting option allows users to simulate the effect of text being erased character by character, mimicking the backspace or delete action. This can be useful for creating dynamic and interactive text animations within Figma designs.


The looping option allows users to continuously repeat the typing and deleting animation, creating an ongoing loop effect. This can be particularly handy for creating eye-catching and attention-grabbing text-based animations or prototypes.


Overall, this Figma plugin offers a convenient way to add dynamic typing effects to text elements in Figma, enhancing the visual appeal and interactivity of designs.

accepted.name: Ayyoub Essadeq
accepted.description: I am an ambitious software engineer passionate about open source projects. Skilled and dedicated, I thoroughly enjoy my work.

plugins.tagline: typeff enables users to automatically create typing effect animation.

plugins.name: Crop and Flatten as Image
plugins.description:
This plugin will convert each selected node to a flattened, rasterized image that is cropped to its actual size. This is ideal for pre-processing slides before exporting as PDF, as you can dramatically reduce the file size by cropping large fills and flattening layers of images and gradients into a single image. It is a simple image optimization & compression technique that can be combined with post-processing the PDF for much smaller files.


Choose PNG if you are flattening images that require transparency, otherwise JPG (it will default to a white background).


Note: This is a destructive action, so it is best to do it on a copy.

accepted.name: Matt DesLauriers
accepted.description: Generative Artist & Creative Coder

plugins.tagline: convert a group to a single cropped and flattened image, for optimization

plugins.name: Instance Utils
plugins.description:
Gives you ultimate control over nested instances, tweak ◇s around without detaching.


👉 Video Tutorial


Major Update Highlights:


Tuesday, Dec, 26th, 2023

  1. Major speed optimizations.
  2. Added the full "integrated slot" workflow.
  3. Updated UI to include a setting page, as well as slot creation and slot consumption pages.


Monday, Aug, 8th, 2022

  1. Added back Table (row based) control function
  2. ^Works on all table instances as long as its direct children are ◇rows, and the direct children of each ◇row are ◇cells.
  3. If the table contain a table header, make sure the name of the header row includes letter 'h'


Thursday, May, 26th, 2022

  1. Brought back the seamless slot edit functionality, and made it more bug-prove, also changed the matching rule to ◇'s ❖ name must include 'slot'(case insensitive).


Sunday, May, 22th, 2022

  1. Added the ability to assimilate nearby instance by pressing the directional arrow button while holding ⌥


Saturday, May, 21th, 2022

  1. Rewrote the whole plugin using React
  2. Fixed all known bugs
  3. Reworked algorithms
  4. Supports multi-copy and multi-paste
  5. Supports Dark mode


Monday, September 27th, 2021

  1. Added support for ".slot" naming


Sunday, September 26th, 2021

  1. Added the ability to Swap the main components on 2 instances only, triggered by clicking on the arrow button while holding down ⌥(alt) key


Wednesday, September 15th, 2021

  1. Added Mutual variants
  2. Added ability to paste Component only


Friday, September 10th, 2021

  1. Added Seamless workflow with ◇Slot


Thursday, August 5th, 2021

  1. Now the pasted instance will take on the former instances' auto layout attributes


Saturday, May 1st, 2021

  1. Copy is now stored in the plugin, you can close the plugin without losing your last copy.
  2. Minor UX improvements
  3. Added support for setting up "Table (Row Based)"


Tuesday, March 29th, 2021

  1. Added the ability to quickly assimilate adjacent instance, triggered by clicking on the arrow button while holding down ⌥(alt) key


Tuesday, March 9th, 2021

  1. Added the ability to edit a instance in place (locally)
  2. Fixed some layer's visibility issue.


Thursday, February 16th, 2021

  1. Addressed an edge case where missing fonts could cause fatal runtime errors
  2. Addressed an edge case where hidden layers could cause unbelievable slowness

  1. Improved UI Logic

  1. Rewrote the algorithm, 5x overall performance improvement on average, and up to 20x more responsive.
  2. Fixed a bug where the auto-layout resizing mode and paddings would not be transferred. Now everything works as expected.


Feature Roadmaps:

  1. Finer control over which property to be transfered.

plugins.name: Icon Set Generator
plugins.description:
Simple figma plugin to generate component variants for icons.


Plugin capabilities:

  • Batch generation of icon component variant sets or creation of a single icon variants.
  • Preservation of nested overrides when swapping icons on UI components by merging nested vectors.
  • Removal of transparent bound layers and groups to optimize the generated icons.
  • Automatic application of local style for the created icon set.
  • Automatic tokenization of the component name following the naming convention $icon-name.
  • Customizable stroke settings for each size.


How to use:

  1. Select one or multiple icon frames.
  2. Specify the desired size variants.
  3. Optionally, choose a local color style or set custom strokes for line icons.
  4. Click on the "Generate" button.

plugins.name: Link to Documentation
plugins.description:
Open documentation pages from your components.

—————————————————————————————————
How to use:

Add Link:
1. Select a layer/component and run Link to Documentation > Add Link.
2. Enter a URL to your documentation page.
3. Optionally, you can check "Add 📖  emoji to layer name" so it will be easier to tell which layers have documentations links.
4. Click "Add Link".

If you are adding a link to a component, it is recommended to add it to the master component so all its instances will have access to the same link.

If you are adding a link to a team library component, make sure to publish an update of the library so other files using this component will have access to the link as well.

Remove Link:
1. Select a layer/component and run Link to Documentation > Remove Link.

View Documentation:
1. Select a layer/component with a documentation link. (See above)
2. Run Link to Documentation > View Documentation.

—————————————————————————————————
Note:
Plugins are currenly not available to users with read-only access to files. To work around this limitation, have your read-only users duplicate the file as a draft and use the plugin on their own copies.

plugins.name: Textsmith
plugins.description:
Textsmith is the ultimate text reshaping tool that lets you easily manipulate, transform, distort, and warp text for creative and professional designs. With its redesigned drag-and-drop interface, new advanced tools, and built-in shortcut key support, it’s perfect for typography design, logos, posters, and more.


🚀 What it does:

Textsmith simplifies text manipulation by allowing users to reshape text directly. Whether you need to bend, morph, or customize fonts, this tool makes it effortless. With access to a huge library of Google Fonts, customizable fill colors, and stroke colors, you can create unique typography distortion effects in seconds. Advanced features like zooming, panning, background grids, snap-to-grid, undo/redo, and shortcut key support give you precise control over your designs.


Once your design is ready, it is automatically exported as an SVG path, where you can take advantage of Figma’s built-in SVG path editing capabilities for additional fine-tuning.


⚙️ Key Features:

  1. Reshape text with drag-and-drop control points.
  2. Access a vast library of Google Fonts for endless design options.
  3. Apply text warping and bending for creative typography.
  4. Use control mirroring to mirror control point positions horizontally or vertically.
  5. Customize fill colors and stroke colors to enhance your designs.
  6. Seamlessly integrate with Figma for advanced path editing.
  7. NEW: Enable or disable background grids for precise alignment.
  8. NEW: Snap to the grid for perfect positioning or turn it off for freeform creativity.
  9. NEW: Undo and redo functionality for quick corrections.
  10. NEW: Zoom and pan controls for better navigation and close-up editing.
  11. NEW: Shortcut key support for all new features, making your workflow faster and more efficient.


📝 Instructions: Using Textsmith is quick and easy:

  1. Input the text you want to reshape.
  2. Select a font from our extensive library of Google Fonts.
  3. Drag control points to distort, transform, or warp the text as needed.
  4. [Optional] Use control mirroring to achieve symmetrical designs by mirroring control points horizontally or vertically.
  5. [Optional] Pick a fill color and a stroke color to further customize your text.
  6. Use zoom and pan controls to focus on specific areas of your design.
  7. Use undo and redo to make quick corrections.
  8. Once you’re done, your reshaped text is automatically added to Figma as an SVG path, ready for fine-tuning using Figma’s path editing tools.


Textsmith is the ultimate typography tool for designers looking to reshape, warp, or transform text into creative and professional designs. Whether you’re a beginner or a seasoned designer, Textsmith makes it easy to create stunning text distortion effects for any project.


Start reshaping text today with Textsmith – the easiest way to manipulate text, bend fonts, and add unique typography effects to your designs.
plugins.tagline: Reshape, Warp, Manipulate and Transform Text with SVG Path Export

plugins.name: Offset Resizer
plugins.description:
Offset frames, components and component sets by a uniform distance from their contents.


Offset Resizer is for when you have a frame you want to “Resize to fit”, but you also need a margin. It works on frames, components and component sets.


NEW – We've added an option to set the left & right margin independently


How to run Offset Resizer


Offset Resizer is keyboard operated.


→ Select the frame (or frames) you want to resize.

→ Type ⌘ + / to open Figma’s quick actions search bar (or Ctrl + / if you are on Windows).

→ Type “Offset” to search for and run the plugin.

→ Enter the offset you want to apply, or select one of the preset values.

→ Hit Enter to run the plugin, or Tab to enter a separate left & right margin.


_


Many thanks to Nick Qurle for his help on the latest update.

plugins.name: Palette From Image
plugins.description:
Want to generate Color Palettes from Images?


This plugin helps you do so, you no longer need to have your image inside your Figma file, you can just select an image from your computer and generate a color palette


What are some awesome features of this plugin ?


(1) Palette from Image does not send your images to a server - it is all generated inside your application


(2) Palette from Image has offline support - you don't need to be online to generate color palettes


(3) Palette from Image gives you access to the color code of each block of color in the palette ( by simply tapping on it)


Want to know more ? Here's a link to the web version with more features ( we plan on adding these features to this plugin with time )


Link below 👇

Color Palette Generator | Color Palette Hub


FAQ 💭


(1) Is Palette From Image secure ?


Yes it is secure - we don't send your images to a server to process them, the plugin can even work offline - all the color extraction and selection happens within the web environment given to me by Figma


(2) Can I use this Palette from Image offline ?


Yes you can use the plugin offline


(3) Can I Export Palette to Image ?


No, you can't for now, but we have a web version that allows that here's a link : Color Palette Generator | Color Palette Hub

plugins.name: Rectangle to Frame
plugins.description:
A tiny plugin that allows you to turn rectangles into frames.


⭐️ How it works:

Sometimes you create a rectangle as a background for something, and then you place some items on top and wish you created a frame in the first place. This plugin allows you to fix this mistake easily. Select a rectangle, then select the objects you want to place in the frame and run the plugin.


TL;DR: It works like auto layout creation but without auto layout.

plugins.name: Penpot Exporter
plugins.description:
This plugin can convert a Figma file into a Penpot compatible format. This will generate a .zip file that you can import into Penpot. The plugin is Open Source, just like Penpot, and you can see its development in our Github and see its Roadmap.


What can this plugin currently import?

Most of the Figma features supported on Penpot are already being exported by the plugin:


  1. Basic shapes (Rectangles, Ellipses, Stars and Polygons)
  2. Vectors, Lines and Arrows
  3. Frames and Sections (Boards in Penpot)
  4. Groups and Boolean groups
  5. Masks
  6. Texts (you can upload your own fonts too)
  7. All basic shapes properties (fills, visibility, strokes, corner radius, shadows, rotations, effects, etc...)
  8. Components and Components Sets
  9. Component instances
  10. Auto Layouts
  11. Color and Typography libraries


How to use the plug-in

Do you have doubts about how to use the plug-in? Visit the Wiki, where you’ll find different step-by-step guides, including:

  1. How to export/import files from Figma to Penpot
  2. How to export custom fonts
  3. How to export design systems (libraries)


Exportation time

Please note that the exportation time may vary depending on the size of the file and the specs of your computer. Larger files may take a bit longer to process. So, why not take a well deserved coffee break while your file gets ready to be enjoyed in Penpot? ☕ We are continuously optimizing the plugin to ensure a smooth and efficient experience. Your patience is appreciated, and we’re excited for you to try it.


For the best experience we recommend using the Figma Desktop App to do the export of large files.


Want to test the plug-in with sample files first?

Before using the plug-in with your own files, you can try it out with these community files:

  1. Small File: Android App Icons - Ideal for trying the exportation of a larger file. ⏱️ Export time around: 1 minute
  2. Larger File: Android UI Kit - Ideal for trying the exportation of a larger file. ⏱️ Export time around: 20 minute


Reporting Issues

Please read our guide on how to report issues:

  1. How to report an Issue


License

License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this
file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.

Copyright (c) KALEIDOS INC

Penpot and the Penpot exporter plugin are Kaleidos’ open source projects
plugins.tagline: Migrate your files from Figma to Penpot

plugins.name: FigGen - HTML + Tailwind Converter
plugins.description:
Pixel perfect HTML/Tailwind for Figma Auto layout designs.


Features:

  • Utility first approach to generate pixel perfect markup for Figma designs.
  • Built for future, uses flex and respects item spacing
  • No clumsy/frugal code with absolutely positioned elements
  • Uses tailwind 3.0
  • Export assets to zip with a click
  • Handles auto layout and its constraints (better design scalability for both designers and developers)
  • Option to mark exportable assets in your preferred format from Figma itself
  • Handles most common usecases like borders, shadows, background colors, text styles, etc.


Usage:

Figma to code conversion is no rocket science, but for pixel perfect UI, we have to do some pre-processing to unfold the magic. Let’s look at some ways to achieve accurate results:

  • Ensure that the frames have auto layout. It helps us to parse your Design better and also good for scaling designs in long term.
  • Mark the image/icon layers for export in the desirable format. We will import the asset in the selected format for you.
  • Avoid the use of Fixed Height/Width constraints as much as possible. Nearly same results can be achieved using ‘Fill container’/’Hug contents’ constraint.

accepted.name: Ayush Singh
accepted.description:
Senior Frontend Engineer @ Disney+ Hotstar. Previously @ Flipkart
Bridging the gap between engineering and design.

plugins.name: Thrshold
plugins.description:
Apply simple Threshold Effect Filter on images. Convert images to alpha masks.


________


1. How does it work ?


• select one (or many) shape with an image fill

• use slider or input to set threshold value

• click on "Apply"


Options :


- Transparent makes the white parts.. transparent

- Alpha masks creates image masks based on lightness


________


2. What is it ?


Thresholding replace each pixel in an image with a black pixel, if the image intensity is less than the threshold value, or a white pixel otherwise.

plugins.name: Lucide Icon Toolkit by Iconduck
plugins.description:
Lucide Icon Toolkit is an open source library of 836 icons.


It's been open sourced under the ISC license, and all icons can be used in your Figma designs.


They're some of the more fun and quirky designed icons we've seen, so we hope you include them in fun projects :)


Popular Lucide icons:

  • Bell and notification icons
  • Location icons
  • Lock and security icons


Plugin features:

  • Drag and drop any icons
  • Search through them instantly
  • Click any icon to add it your design


Coming soon:

  • Save your favorite Lucide icon
  • View your search history
  • View your embed history

plugins.name: Figaro
plugins.description:
Think of Figaro as your personal AI design intern (it’s useful but pretty new here). You can work with it to design and modify shapes, lines, frames and compose copy together. Simply have a chat with Figaro to agree on what to make or edit and it will do the rest for you.


What Figaro can do:

  • Discuss what to make: Chat with Figaro to agree on what to make so you don’t have to ‘nail’ your design in one shot.
  • Compose copy together - Write some words for your designs and change the style and tone ie. no more Lorem Ipsum.
  • Edit existing objects and text - Click on any object and chat with Figaro to edit it until you get it just right.
  • Create shapes, lines, frames - You can control color, fill, stroke, size, position, drop shadow, blur etc. of shapes, lines and frames.
  • Fail, from time to time - Like any intern—Figaro has a lot of potential and great intentions but can be a little clumsy. Some patience will be required!


Figaro is free, fun and ready to use (no API key needed). It’s made by Marta, Kate and Stina from trai.studio. Three designers and creative technologists who build little, joyful experiences so anyone can try AI.

accepted.name: Marta
accepted.description:
Creative technologist prototyping joyful experiences with AI.
xGoogle and xIDEO

plugins.tagline: Work collaboratively with this fig-titious AI design intern to create shapes and text together.

plugins.name: Easy Circular/Arc Text
plugins.description:
Turn any text layer into a circular or arced shape with just a few clicks. Adjust spacing, font size, and choose whether the text curves inward or outward. Once your circular text is in place, you can hide or delete the circle guide layer.


How to use:

  1. Select a text layer you want to curve.
  2. Click "Create 🌈".
  3. Adjust spacing and size, then click "Done".


That's it! 🎉


Note: There may be occasional issues when reselecting or editing text layers.
plugins.tagline: Easily shape your text into perfect arcs or circles.

plugins.name: Design System Collection
plugins.description:
Quickly explore relevant design systems in Figma Community. ​


This plugin helps you find the relevant design systems efficiently by​

  • Purposes​
  • Platforms ​
  • Light/Dark Modes​

​

How to use:​

  • Run Plugin <Design System Collection>​
  • Input the product brand or usage in the search bar​
  • Or use the filter to modify the search result​
  • Once you find the final result, it will direct you to the relevant design system in Figma community​


Currently, we are in the Proof-of-concept phase, please feel free to let us know if you have any questions or experienced bugs.
plugins.tagline: Design System Collection helps you explore relevant design systems with ease.
